abstract: In the structure of cancer morbidity of the female genitalia in Azerbaijan SSR within a ten-year period (1957-1966) cervical cancer occupies the first place--86.6%, it is observed more frequently among Russian female population (46.4 per 100 000 wives) and more rarely among aboriginal female population (7.1 per 100 000 wives). Of 2488 patients with cervical cancer 24.5% showed previous lesions against which background cancer would arise. Patients with cervical ruptures, advanced erosions, polyps should be identified as high-risk groups of cervical cancer.
title: [Some epidemiological factors in the incidence of female genital cancer in the Azerbaijan SSR].
